what: Some helper functions to analysis and to create tables for an article in medicine

code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("AliGunerMD/RforMD") library("RforMD")

what: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: function generates scaled color palette based specified color.

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
code: ag_colors_scale(color, num_colors = 8, start = 1, end = 0)

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: color color create palette . Options include "gray", "red", "blue", "green", "orange", "cyan", "magenta", "yellow". num_colors number colors palette. Default 8. start starting value color scale. Default 1. Used gray scale. end ending value color scale. Default 0. Used gray scale.

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: vector colors representing scaled color palette.

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: Ali Guner

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
code: if (FALSE) { ag_colors_scale("yellow", 1) ag_colors_scale("gray", 255) }

title: ag_colors_standard — ag_colors_standard
text: define single color standardizing color use projects (Source: RColorBrewer)

title: ag_colors_standard — ag_colors_standard
code: ag_colors_standard(palette_name = NULL)

title: ag_colors_standard — ag_colors_standard
text: palette_name character string specifying name desired color palette. NULL (default), palette randomly selected.

title: ag_colors_standard — ag_colors_standard
text: vector representing either selected color palette randomly chosen color palette.

title: ag_colors_standard — ag_colors_standard
code: # Select a specific palette ag_colors_standard("greens") #> [1] "#F7FCF5" "#E5F5E0" "#C7E9C0" "#A1D99B" "#74C476" "#41AB5D" "#238B45" #> [8] "#005A32" ag_colors_standard("greens")[4] #> [1] "#A1D99B"  # Randomly select a color from any palette ag_colors_standard() #> [1] "#BDBDBD"

what: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: function creates Excel file column names main dataset.

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
code: ag_create_excel(   dataset = analysis_dataset,   excel_path = "_Data/Variables.xlsx" )

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: dataset dataset extract column names . Default 'analysis_dataset'. excel_path path filename Excel file. Default "_Data/Variables.xlsx".

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: Saves .xlsx file path.

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: Ali Guner

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
code: if (FALSE) { #' ag_create_excel(dataset = iris) ag_create_excel(dataset = penguins, excel_path = "MyExcelFile.xlsx") }

title: Create Project Folders — ag_create_project_folders
text: function automates creation essential folder structures new R project. sets main directories "_Codes," "_Outputs," "_Data," along subdirectories, subfolders, necessary files organizing project efficiently. function performs following steps: 1. Creates main folders: "_Codes," "_Outputs," "_Data." 2. Sets subfolders within "_Codes," including "_Functions." 3. Creates README file within "_Codes" named "00 README.md" project documentation. 4. Sets subfolders within "_Outputs," including "_Figures" "_Tables." 5. Sets subfolders within "_Data," including "_Raw" "_Processed." 6. Checks deletes single .qmd file main directory user confirmation. 7. Inserts new .qmd template file using ag_generate_template_quarto() moves "_Codes" folder "01 initial.qmd." #' function designed used right creating new R project via "New Project" project creation method.

title: Create Project Folders — ag_create_project_folders
code: ag_create_project_folders()

title: Create Project Folders — ag_create_project_folders
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage ag_create_project_folders() }

what: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: function adjusts column values ag_ff_summary table. Converts parametric values (Total Groups columns, whichever present) Mean ± SD, Median (Q1- Q3) Also clean levels levels argument TRUE.

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
code: ag_ff_columns(.data, levels = FALSE)

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: .data input ag_ff_summary table. levels Clean levels, default FALSE.

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: modified ag_ff_summary table adjusted column values.

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: Ali Guner

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
code: if (FALSE) { table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary(penguins, "species", table_vars_1) %>% ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>% ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE)  table_vars_2 <- iris %>% dplyr::select(-Species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary(iris, "Species", table_vars_2) %>% ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>% ag_ff_columns() }

what: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
text: function renames labels ag_ff_summary table based vector old new names Excel file. can define old names new names inside R chunk. using external excel file convenient. Variables.xlsx file, consider using ag_create_excel

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
code: ag_ff_labels(   .data,   use_vector = TRUE,   vector_name = NULL,   use_excel = FALSE,   excel_path = "_Data/Variables.xlsx",   excel_old_names = "original",   excel_new_names = "corrected" )

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
text: .data ag_ff_summary table modified. use_vector Logical value indicating whether use vector renaming labels. Default TRUE. vector_name name vector containing old new label names. Required use_vector = TRUE. use_excel Logical value indicating whether use Excel file renaming labels. Default FALSE. excel_path path Excel file containing old new label names. Required use_excel = TRUE. excel_old_names name column Excel file containing old label names. Default "original". excel_new_names name column Excel file containing new label names. Default "corrected".

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
text: ag_ff_summary table renamed labels.

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
code: if (FALSE) { label_names <- c(   "Sepal.Length" = "Sepal length",   "Sepal.Width" = "Sepal width",   "Petal.Length" = "Petal length",   "Petal.Width" = "Petal width",   "Species" = "Species" )  ag_ff_summary(iris, "Species", table_vars_2) %>%   ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>%   ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%   ag_ff_labels(use_vector = TRUE, vector_name = label_names)  ag_ff_summary(iris, "Species", table_vars_2) %>%   ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>%   ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%   ag_ff_labels(use_excel = TRUE) }

what: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
title: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: function relocates columns finalfit summary table based specified order, considering different strata analysis options. primarily designed work datasets generated ag_ff_summary function.

title: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
code: ag_ff_relocate(.data, order = NULL)

title: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: .data input (ag_ff_summary table) modified. order Optional. order relocate columns. Default "GTP". Possible values : "G" (Groups), "GP" (Groups P-value), "GT" (Groups Total), "GTP" (Groups, Total, P-value), "TGP" (Total, Groups, P-value), "T" (Total). dataset 3 columns, means strata used, order argument needed.

title: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: Modified dataset relocated columns.

title: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: Ali Guner

title: Relocate Columns of finalfit summary table — ag_ff_relocate
code: if (FALSE) { table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary(penguins, table_vars = table_vars_1) %>% ag_ff_relocate()  ag_ff_summary(penguins, "species", table_vars_1) %>% ag_ff_relocate("TGP") }

title: Enhanced version of finalfit::summary_factorlist — ag_ff_summary
text: Generate aggregated summary statistics tests categorical continuous variables, option Fisher's correction contingency tables. function extends functionality `summary_factorlist` function introducing Fisher's test Shapiro-Wilk test. Normality distributions continuous variables evaluated Shapiro-Wilk test required test decided based test. categorical variables, expected cell frequencies calculated (expected cell frequencies less 5 20 contingency table may require using Fisher test) required test (Chi-square Fisher) decided based . row_col_sums function can used presenting different sum styles. default one, sums rows 100 approach good summary tables.

title: Enhanced version of finalfit::summary_factorlist — ag_ff_summary
code: ag_ff_summary(   dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars,   row_col_sums = "row_col_based",   all_cont = "shapiro",   manual_nonparams = NULL,   fisher_correction = TRUE,   na_include = FALSE,   summary_factorlist_args = list(),   ... )

title: Enhanced version of finalfit::summary_factorlist — ag_ff_summary
text: dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata dependent variable (outcome) analysis, factor. table_vars character vector specifying explanatory variables (predictors) analysis. can factors, characters, numerics. row_col_sums character string specifying type summary statistics generated. Options include "row_based" row-based summaries, "col_based" column-based summaries, "row_col_based" row column-based summaries. Default "row_col_based". all_cont character string specifying approach continuous variables. Options include "parametric" parametric tests (mean), "nonparametric" non-parametric tests (median), "shapiro" using Shapiro-Wilk test normality choosing parametric non-parametric accordingly. Default "shapiro". Manual option also possible manual_nonparams. manual_nonparams all_cont set "manual", argument contain values (index, name varible) cont_nonpara. empty case. fisher_correction Logical, indicating whether Fisher's correction applied expected cell frequencies less 5 20 Default TRUE. na_include Logical, indicating whether missing values included analysis. Default TRUE. summary_factorlist_args list containing additional arguments passed ag_ff_summary. comes finalfit::summaryfactorlist function.                                Default empty list. ... Additional arguments passed ag_ff_summary.

title: Enhanced version of finalfit::summary_factorlist — ag_ff_summary
text: data frame containing aggregated summary statistics test results.

title: Enhanced version of finalfit::summary_factorlist — ag_ff_summary
text: Ali Guner

title: Enhanced version of finalfit::summary_factorlist — ag_ff_summary
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage of ag_ff_summary function library(palmerpenguins)  strata <- "species" table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary( dataset = penguins, table_vars = table_vars_1, strata = "species" ) }

what: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: function performs contingency table analysis specified factor character variables given dataset, option identify variables exhibiting expected cell frequencies less 5 20 designed handle potential issues gracefully, providing informative warnings excluding rows missing values strata variable necessary. function can display observed /expected values tables based user preferences.

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
code: ag_fisher(   dataset,   strata,   table_vars,   silence = TRUE,   observed_tables = FALSE,   expected_tables = FALSE )

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: dataset dataset containing variables interest. strata stratifying factor variable analysis. table_vars character vector factor variable names analyze. silence Logical, indicating whether suppress warnings. Default TRUE. observed_tables Logical, indicating whether display contingency tables observed values. Default FALSE. expected_tables Logical, indicating whether display tables expected values. Default FALSE.

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: character vector factor variable names low expected cell frequencies, NULL none found.

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: Ali Guner

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
code: if (FALSE) { # Usage example: library(palmerpenguins)  table_vars <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  strata <- "species"  ag_fisher(penguins, table_vars = table_vars, strata = strata, silence = TRUE, observed_tables = TRUE) ag_fisher(penguins, table_vars = table_vars, strata = strata, silence = FALSE, observed_tables = TRUE, expected_tables = TRUE) }

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: function generates styled flextable specified font family font size. flextable configured default font settings, 'theme_booktabs', additional styling make first row bold header.

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
code: ag_flex(data, flex_font_family = "Arial", flex_font_size = 11)

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: data data frame tibble displayed flextable. flex_font_family Character, font family text flextable. flex_font_size Numeric, font size text flextable.

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: flextable object customized styling.

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: Ali Guner

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
code: if (FALSE) { # Assuming you have a data frame named 'my_data' my_data %>% ag_flex() my_data %>% ag_flex(flex_font_family = "Times New Roman", flex_font_size = 14)  # If you want to undo bold() bold(i = 1, j = NULL, bold = FALSE, part = "header") }

code: ag_generate_template_quarto(name = "01 initial.qmd", open = interactive(), ...)

title: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
text: name character string specifying name output Quarto document. provided, default name "01 initial.qmd". open logical indicating whether open newly created Quarto document interactively. ... Additional arguments passed use_template function.

text: None

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: ag_make_colors function generates color palette consisting normal, darker, lighter colors based random hues.

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
code: ag_make_colors(num_colors, seed = 2023)

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: num_colors integer specifying number colors generate color palette. seed optional argument specifying seed random number generator. provided, default seed 2023 used.

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: list following components (1000 different options defined): palette list containing color palette. color palette represented list following components: normal_color, darker_color, lighter_color. normal vector normal colors palette. darker vector darker colors palette. lighter vector lighter colors palette.

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: Ali Guner

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
code: if (FALSE) { # Generate a color palette with 5 colors using the default seed: colors <- ag_make_colors(5)  # Generate a color palette with 10 colors using a specific seed: colors <- ag_make_colors(10, seed = 1967)  # Extract the color palette palette <- colors$palette  # Extract the normal colors normal_colors <- colors$normal  # Extract the darker colors darker_colors <- colors$dark  # Extract the lighter colors lighter_colors <- colors$light }  #' @export

what: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: function conducts Shapiro-Wilk test normality numeric variables dataset, either entire dataset within specified strata. returns names counts variables found non-normally distributed based significance level 0.05. test, variables desired tests, defined explanatory vector.

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
code: ag_shapiro(   dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   silence = FALSE,   names = TRUE )

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata optional grouping variable stratified analysis. Default NULL. table_vars character vector variable names tested normality. Can defined names(select()) functions. NULL, function use numeric variables dataset, except strata present (RECOMMENDED, better idea define table_vars) silence Logical. FALSE, displays informative messages analysis. Default FALSE names Logical. TRUE, returns names non-normally distributed variables; FALSE, returns indices variables. Default TRUE

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: character vector containing names non-normally distributed variables integer count, based specified value 'names' argument.

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: Ali Guner

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
code: if (FALSE) {  table_vars <- c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width", "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width") or table_vars <- iris %>% dplyr::select(-Species) %>% names() dependent <- "Species"  ag_shapiro(dataset = iris, table_vars = table_vars) ag_shapiro(dataset = iris, table_vars = table_vars, silence = TRUE, names = FALSE) }

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
text: function calculates Shapiro-Wilk p-values normality testing numeric variables dataset.

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
code: ag_shapiro_results(dataset, strata = NULL, table_vars = NULL, asteriks = TRUE)

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
text: dataset input dataset. strata (Optional) column name dataset stratify analysis . Default NULL. table_vars character vector variable names include analysis. asteriks TRUE, test results reader-friendly. Default TRUE.

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
text: tibble columns variable names Shapiro-Wilk p-values.

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
code: table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names() #> Error in penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names(): could not find function "%>%"  ag_shapiro_results(penguins, "species", table_vars_1) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'table_vars_1' not found

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: ag_theme() function defines custom theme ggplot2 plots specific styling preferences. theme enhances visual appeal consistency plots customizing various elements.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
code: ag_theme(my_plot_size = 12, my_font = "Arial", ...)

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: my_plot_size Numeric, size text plot. my_font Character, font family text plot.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: function returns ggplot2 theme object can applied ggplot objects achieve specified custom styling.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: theme includes following customizations: - Light background minimal grid lines (theme_light()). - Custom font family (Helvetica) size text elements. - Legends positioned top plot. - Adjusted sizes legend text, axis text, strip text. - Gray background facet strips. - Increased panel spacing removed panel borders. - Bold centrally aligned plot title, centered plot subtitle.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: Ali Guner

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage library(ggplot2) my_plot <- ggplot(data = my_data, aes(x = x_variable, y = y_variable)) +   geom_point() +   ag_theme() print(my_plot) }

what: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: function generates row column-based summary statistics based specified method.

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
code: ff_row_col_sums(   dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   na_include = NULL,   cont = NULL,   cont_nonpara = NULL,   fisher_correction = NULL,   row_col_sums,   ... )

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata dependent variable hypothesis testing. table_vars vector explanatory variables analysis. na_include Logical. NA values included analysis? Default NULL. cont type measure continuous variables. Default NULL. cont_nonpara vector specifying non-parametric measures continuous variables. Default NULL. fisher_correction Logical. Fisher's exact tests corrected? Default NULL. row_col_sums method generating row column-based summary statistics. Use 'row_based' 'col_based'. ... Additional arguments passed underlying functions.

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: summary factor list containing row column-based summary statistics.

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: Ali Guner

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage of ff_row_col_sums function row_col_result <- ff_row_col_sums(my_data, strata = "Response", table_vars = c("Var1", "Var2"), row_col_sums = "row_based") }

title: karadeniz color pallette — karadeniz
text: Multiple color palettes based "palette" argument

code: if (FALSE) { iris %>% ggplot(aes(Petal.Length, Petal.Width, color = Species))+ geom_point() + scale_color_karadeniz() }  iris %>% ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Petal.Length)) + geom_point() + scale_color_karadeniz(palette = "Vazil", discrete = FALSE) #> Error in iris %>% ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Petal.Length)): could not find function "%>%"

title: minimized version of summary_factorlist — short_ff
text: Perform Short Summary Statistics Hypothesis Testing function generates short summary statistics conducts hypothesis testing, including chi-square tests Fisher's exact tests specified.

title: minimized version of summary_factorlist — short_ff
code: short_ff(   dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   na_include = NULL,   cont = NULL,   cont_nonpara = NULL,   fisher_correction = fisher_correction,   ... )

title: minimized version of summary_factorlist — short_ff
text: dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata dependent variable hypothesis testing. table_vars vector explanatory variables analysis. na_include Logical. NA values included analysis? Default NULL. cont type measure continuous variables. Default NULL. cont_nonpara vector specifying non-parametric measures continuous variables. Default NULL. fisher_correction Logical. Fisher's exact tests corrected? Default NULL. ... Additional arguments passed underlying functions.

title: minimized version of summary_factorlist — short_ff
text: summary factor list containing short summary statistics hypothesis testing results.

text: Ali Guner
